comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

In Unified Folders Inbox, Either set Forward Preferences to Forward As Attachment, or select Message, Forward As, Attachment.


Actual results:

Message is forwarded from Default account.


Expected results:

Message should be forwarded from account from which the message originated.

Note: This only occurs if Forwarding As Attachment. Forward Inline uses the proper account for forwarding.

My complete write-up:

I have confirmed this on 2 different installations of Thunderbird 5.0. One on Fedora 14 x86 and the other on RHEL 6.1 Workstation x86.

If I have more than one account and am using Unified Folders and have Forwarding set to "As Attachment" (or select Forward As Attachment from the Message menu), the account selected to be used to forward the message will be the default account, not the account from which the message originated. This is in contrast to prior behavior and in contrast to forward inline, which forwards from the originally associated account with the e-mail.

This behavior only occurs if the message is selected from the Unified Folders list. If it is selected from within the inbox of the account itself, the Forward As Attachment defaults to sending from the originally associated e-mail account properly.

I just confirmed this bug beyond Linux. If you follow what I have described, the bug exists. I installed a WinXP VM with a clean install of Thunderbird 7.0.1. I only configured two accounts, both GMail. If you are using Unified Folders, Forward As will always forward from the default e-mail account, not the account to which the e-mail was originally sent. I can send screentshots and/or take video if someone would like.

Bug confirmed by me on:
RHEL 6.0 32-bit
RHEL 6.1 32-bit
Fedora 14 32-bit
Fedora 14 x64
Windows XP 32-bit

Thunderbird 5.0 + (all versions)
